Are you sure, that people will understand what you asked? Where is htmlagilitypack in your question?
Thats is just the question how can i do that with htmlagilitypack and VB.Net webbrowsere.body.innerhtml?

You can parse html with htmlagilitypack, change html and send this changed html to webbrowser (with filled textboxes and etc...). But I personally would preffer other approach: access DOM on webbrowser control. You will save on some unneeded processing. Your choice.
